content.description: A technical shallow corner, with gear and bolts. Easier than Crystal Gratitude, but requires a bit more thought.
content.location: Start is same as Crystal Gratitude but angle up and left on the choss after the piton and up to a small corner. First bolt is about 30' up. Bolted Anchors.

climbs.name: From the Corner to the Block

content.description: Beautiful and pumpy climbing up steep corners and blocks. No definitive crux, but lots of big moves.
content.location: About 50 feet right of Crystal Gratitude.(The curving splitter.)

content.description: Start with some easy choss and a pin then 3 bolts of interesting face climbing.  Then attack the steep curving splitter. Pumpy!
content.protection: Clip a pin then it's 3 Bolts to Gear: a .2, .3, two .4's, .5, .75, two #1's and 3 #2's. (BD C4). Bolted anchor with fixed biners
content.location: Start just below and right of the Cave.  Climb faces mostly east and gets decent shade in the afternoon.

content.description: The first South facing wall on your left as you hike into Marg's Draw.  It's located below Snoopy and Slingshot Rock. The wall is roughly 100 feet tall. A bit chossy, but really fun with all day sun.
